definition: meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: There was a roar of anger from his fellows: Scabior drew his wand.
sentences.chinese: 他的同伙们怒吼起来，斯卡比奥拔出魔杖。

sentences.english: It is the clearest possible directive to Gaddafi and his cohorts to end the killing.
sentences.chinese: 这是要求卡扎菲和同伙结束杀戮最为明确的一项指令。

sentences.english: Police are out hunting Deca Aliyev and his associates.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在全力追捕德卡耶夫及其同伙。

sentences.english: Inom dinning out with my friends this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我将和同伙在外观吃饭。
那女仆打入玛丽家为同伙日后行窃踩点。

sentences.english: John and his crowd went into the discotheque.
sentences.chinese: 约翰及他的同伙走进了那家迪斯可舞厅。

sentences.english: I don't want it to be said I grassed on my mates.
sentences.chinese: 我不希望别人说我告发了同伙。

sentences.english: But then he sees the concern on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 但是他马上看出同伙们脸上的顾虑。

sentences.english: She visited him in jail and hid for four days.
sentences.chinese: 其后，该女子到监狱探视同伙，并在监狱中藏了四天。

sentences.english: He procured the fake gear in China and then sent them to co-conspirators in the US.
sentences.chinese: 李在中国采购这些设备，然后将其运给在美国的同伙。

sentences.english: Police are still looking for his primo buddies.
sentences.chinese: 警方仍然在寻找他的其他同伙。

sentences.english: It has distributed networks and affiliates in Algeria.
sentences.chinese: 他们在阿尔及利亚也有分布网点和同伙。

sentences.english: They have affiliates in many countries and are trying to expand their reach.
sentences.chinese: 他们在很多国家都有同伙，并企图扩大他们的影响。

sentences.english: The thief lured him to the doorway and his accomplice hit him on the head.
sentences.chinese: 小偷把他引到了门洞里，他的同伙在他头上重重一击。

sentences.english: A court sentenced her and her accomplices to 10 months of community service.
sentences.chinese: 法院判处她和她的同伙从事10个月的社区服务。

sentences.english: Pai and his associates wanted to get rid of Chiang in order to save something from the wreck of Kuomintang power.
sentences.chinese: 白及其同伙想要除掉蒋，使国民党政权得以苟延残喘。

definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
